awardEventDetails.title: 2021 Winner Critics Choice Award
awardEventDetails.for: Best Movie Made for Television

awardEventDetails.title: 2021 Winner Special Award
awardEventDetails.description: (HAMILTON transcends the definition of movies and television to rise up to the highest of art. This work of dazzling brilliance now exists for the ages - standing as a monument to America's founding fathers and an anthem to the power of art to tell our stories. In a year when many were isolated at home, this lavishly cinematic staging of Lin-Manuel Miranda's musical masterpiece invited the world to take a front row seat in the "room where it happens" and experience the multi-layered genius of this cultural juggernaut.)

awardsHtml:
19 wins & 46 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

2021 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie
Leslie Odom Jr. (For playing: "Aaron Burr".)
2021 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie
Lin-Manuel Miranda (For playing: "Alexander Hamilton".)
2021 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Variety Special (Pre-Recorded)
Sander Jacobs (executive producer) - Jill Furman (executive producer) - Maggie Brown (executive producer) - Jon Kamen (co-executive producer) - Dave Sirulnick (co-executive producer) - Justin Wilkes (co-executive producer) - Thomas Kail (produced by) - Lin-Manuel Miranda (produced by) - Jeffrey Seller (produced by)
2021 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Directing for a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie
Thomas Kail
2021 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie
Renée Elise Goldsberry (For playing: "Angelica Schuyler".)

2021 Nominee SLFCA Award

AFI Awards, USA

2021 Winner Special Award
(HAMILTON transcends the definition of movies and television to rise up to the highest of art. This work of dazzling brilliance now exists for the ages - standing as a monument to America's founding fathers and an anthem to the power of art to tell our stories. In a year when many were isolated at home, this lavishly cinematic staging of Lin-Manuel Miranda's musical masterpiece invited the world to take a front row seat in the "room where it happens" and experience the multi-layered genius of this cultural juggernaut.)
